main_definition: Tight refers to something that is firmly fixed in place, lacking flexibility or ease of movement, or has a high level of intensity or severity.

meanings_and_examples.example: His budget for the project was tight; he could only afford basic supplies.
The suit jacket is a little tight around my arms, but it fits well overall.

meanings_and_examples.definition: With difficulty or with much effort
meanings_and_examples.example: I couldn't open the jar because my hands were too weak; I had to ask for help as it was so tight.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Intense, strong, or severe in nature
meanings_and_examples.example: The criticism from his boss felt very tight and hard to take.
The room was filled with furniture so tight that there was hardly any space left for walking.
